Job Posting: 178153 - Position: S26 Internship - Digital Project Engineer 178153 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/23/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 02/06/2026 03:07 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City RTX Corporation (formerly Raytheon Technologies Corporation) 1000 Wilson Blvd Arlington, VA Postal Code / Zip Code 22209 JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Internship - Digital Project Engineer 178153 Co-op Position Mississauga, ON Canada 4 months CAD 23.1 per hour for 0 Major List 23.10 to 33.30 CAD Job Title: Internship - Digital Project Engineer Job ID: 01808645 About Pratt & Whitney Canada Pratt & Whitney Canada (P&WC) is a global leader in the aerospace industry, headquartered in Longueuil, Quebec. We manufacture next-generation engines that power the world's largest fleet of business, general aviation, and regional aircraft and helicopters. For nearly 100 years, we have pioneered advancements in engine development, supporting cargo and equipment, transportation, wildfire suppression, and passenger travel. An Employer of Choice Pratt & Whitney Canada was recognized as one of Canada's Top 10 Employers in 2025 by Forbes and ranked #1 in the aerospace and defense industry in the country. Our headquarters are also listed among the top employers in the Montreal region. These accolades reinforce our reputation as an employer of choice in Montreal, Canada, and worldwide. Why join our team? The candidate will occupy the position of Digital Project Engineer within the Program Management team within Digital Engine Services (DES). You will be reporting to the Associate Director, DES Program Management. The success of our team depends on our ability to manage and successfully deliver Engineering & Digital Transformation projects that will ultimately create positive customer experience for our customers. Internship dates: May 4th to August 21st , 2026 Location: LOC13055 1801Courtney Park Drive,Mississauga,Ontario,L5T 1J3,Canada Check out our YouTube channel: Pratt & Whitney Canada Visit our website: pwc.ca If you are looking for an internship where your contribution will be valued and where you can truly make a difference, our team is the right place for you. At Pratt & Whitney, the difference you make is on display every day. Just look up. Are you ready to go beyond? The position is located at our Plant 22 (Mississauga, Ontario) location, from Monday to Friday, with flexible hours and exclusively on-site. The candidate's responsibilities will therefore generally be related to project engineering. More concretely, the candidate will be called upon to: • Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of digital/technology-driven projects (software, IoT, or analytics initiatives). • Translate business requirements into technical specifications and coordinate with multi-disciplinary team • Develop project schedules, allocate resources, and track progress to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery Prepare project documentation, reports, and status update communication to the respective stakeholders • What will your day-to-day look like? As a digital project engineer, your day-to-day responsibilities consist of: • Monitor project dashboards, timelines, and task progress to ensure that each digital initiative is on track. • Participate daily stand-ups with developers & engineers to track progress, resolve any potential blockers and clarify outstanding requirements. • Update project documentations, change logs, coordination memo, and work instruction manual. • Create and execute testing plan to review few features or capabilities as they are being deployed. • Collaborate with other project engineers to support continuous improvement of program management governance process. • Prepare status update packages for managers & stakeholders. Evaluate new tools that will help in building robust project engineering processes. • Working at Pratt & Whitney Canada The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates. At Pratt & Whitney Canada, we combine passion, boldness, and precision to design, manufacture, and maintain the most advanced and reliable aircraft engines in the world. Our work and the quality of our products contribute to the success of our customers, who in turn save lives, support commerce, connect communities, and protect freedoms. At Pratt & Whitney Canada, you have the opportunity to make a difference every day-just look up. Are you ready to go beyond? The selected candidate will be required to complete a criminal background check and any applicable clearances with respect to the handling and transfer of controlled goods. Employment is conditional upon the successful completion of these checks and obtaining the required clearances. Failure to do so will result in the withdrawal of the employment offer. The salary range for this role is 23.10 to 33.30 CAD. The salary range provided is a good faith estimate representative of all experience levels. RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to the role, function and associated responsibilities, a candidate's work experience, location, education/training, and key skills. This job posting is not for an existing position vacancy. RTX adheres to the principles of equal employment. All qualified applications will be given careful consideration without regard to ethnicity, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or identity, national origin, age disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Requirements What do you need to be successful? • Be eligible to work in Canada. • Be enrolled in a Canadian university throughout your internship. • Be able to work on-site in the province where you are hired if applicable. • French language (advanced level: spoken and written) • Bachelor's degree in science, technology, engineering, or mathematics (STEM) • Prior experience in engineering, operations or project management is an asset • Professional proficiency in English is required Strong verbal and written communication skills with deep project management knowledge is an asset • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
